metadata.dc:title: Climate Iceland
metadata.dc:creator: Willem Koster
metadata.dc:description:
The Climate Iceland is dataset is a collection of data from climate studies in the North Atlantic. Temperature reconstructions or ice sheet reconstructions are present. This database does not hold any data, rather, it contains important information about the studies and links to the actual data.
Willem Koster
NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration), Richard Streeter
9/1/2020

Iceland Greenland Faroe Islands
13,500 BCE - Present
CC BY-NC-ND
Objectid Unique identifier
Elev Elevation (in case of terrestrial cores), or ocean water depth (in case of marine cores)
Site Name Name of the site the core was taken as registered in the metadata associated with the study
Id Sequential number based on time of entry
Date Core Taken Date that the core was taken, recorded as year-month-day
Data Available Is the data available online or not (y/n)
Source Type of sediment that was cored
Reconstruction The reconstruction that was made from (some of) the proxies
Proxy The proxies that were recorded in the studies. Values used in this dataset include Q/K_feldspar ( ), magn_data (), chironomids (), quartz(), calcite (), shell_growth_increments (), Mg/Ca (), d18O (), forams (), carbonates (), diatoms (), alkenones (), ACL25-35 (), UKâ€™37 (), CBT (), dD (), d13C ().
Oldest Date Bp The oldest dated layer recorded in the core (does not mean the bottom of the core) recorded in calendar years BP (Before Present)
Youngest Date Bp The youngest dated layer recorded in the core (does not mean the top of the core) recorded in calendar years BP (Before Present)
Dating Method Type of dating used (radiometric, tephrochronology)
Youngest Date Ce The youngest dated layer recorded in the core (does not mean the top of the core) recorded in calendar years CE (Common Era)
Number Of Samples Type of dating used (radiometric, tephrochronology)
Oldest Date Ce The oldest dated layer recorded in the core (does not mean the bottom of the core) recorded in calendar years CE (Common Era)
Num Dates The number of dated layers in the core
Sampling Resolution The average number of time passed between two proxy samples (in years). Calculated as
Database Link If applicable, a link to an online database where the data and/or the metadata is available
Reference Reference to the paper in which the core/study was published
Latitude Latitude in decimal degrees as registered in metadata
Longitude Longitude in decimal degrees as registered in metadata
Database Link2 If applicable, a second link to an online database where the data and/or the metadata is available
